It was the smile that had overtaken him and toppled his better judgement. It seemed so well-meaning and innocent, and he was forced to admit to himself that she hadn't displayed any signs of a violent motive. From where he stood, she was just the latest catch of his fellow, belligerent tribesmen. They were always trying to overcome the next largest or next ferocious beast, and this was no different. Their prey often presented little to no threat, anyway, and that was what Tanya had been trying to convince him of anyway.

His fingers instantly dropped to the sheath of Oric's machete-like blade, which hung from his waist. Yes, this was the right decision. They had no right to keep her here on any account, and she had virtually promised not to harm him after he did this. Wait, what would the others do if they learned he had set the giantess free? Imprison him for treason, or worse. But a new thought crossed his mind -- Tanya would be able to dissuade anyone from trying take him away once she stood to her full height. She already loomed over him in a prone position!

He slid his blade over the ropes a few times strategically, since he knew where they were the weakest, and they eventually frayed enough to snap. After repeating this process for all four of the main supports, he rushed back across the sands to the jungle's edge as Tanya writhed against the remaining constraints, quickly tearing them from their anchor-like supports in a jaw-dropping display.
"I'm free!" she cried out, looking back down at Oric warmly. "Thanks, little guy. Now let's go."

Setting this "beast" free hadn't been a tough decision based on his prior experience with those that his tribesmen hunted. Now he had even been met with gratitude, and the giantess was actually smiling now. Rolling over slightly and brushing off of the sand accumulated by her immobility on the ground, he was forced to step back. The tremors alone that were caused by this should have knocked him over, but he had braced for it when he first noticed her moving. Still, none of this he deemed as malevolent.

Setting his doubts aside, Oric observed as the titanic girl moved to a crouch position, stared at him for a few seconds, and the reached out. Without any words of permittance, Tanya snagged him in her powerful grip. Although alarmed and above all startled, he didn't struggle.
"Uh... I probably should have asked before doing that, huh? So... you're, like, really a person, huh?" she asked, dumbfounded.
"Yes," he responded, feeling like an exhibit in a zoo with her probing gaze falling over him. "Much like yourself."

"Wow, this is pretty insane. I thought I was all alone on this island, after I woke up..." Tanya said, suddenly stopping. "But whatever, enough about me. Where do you come from? Why are you so different from the others?" The questions were what Oric had expected, and he was prepared to answer.
"I was born here, just like everyone else I've ever met before, well, you," he said, clearing his throat. Tanya nodded her head, listening.

"As for why I'm "different", I'm really not. the others were reasonably not sure what to do with you, because for all they knew you had in mind to destroy us like some of the others monsters that roam this island. Even more so, however, because of your size." To his surprised, the giantess' face was controrted with anger.
"Those insects! They shouldn't judge a person by how they look, or even how big they are. Well... I'll show them how big I am, Oric. They'll see me fine!" Tanya muttered angrily to him, clutching close to her chest as she took a step forward onto the sand, frustration etched in her gait.

13.content:
As Tanya tried to wake up, she felt as though she were laying on something soft, kind of like someone’s flesh. She opened her eyes and saw she was lying on her stomach, but more importantly on a gigantic human hand. She carefully stood up and tried to figure out where she was.

“Oh good, you’re awake. Are you alright?” Tanya heard a loud voice ask. She turned around and saw that the hand she was on belonged to a giantess.
The giantess stood at least a good 70 feet tall, had long black hair that reached her butt, used a pair of huge clam shells for a bra and wore a skirt made of massive palm leaves. “Are you okay?” The giantess repeated.
“Please, don’t hurt me.” Tanya begged.
“Don’t worry; I’m not going to harm you. What’s your name?” the giantess asked compassionately.
“I’m Tanya. W- where am I?” Tanya asked nervously.
“Tanya, huh? That’s a nice name. Mine’s Loretta. As for where you are, you’re at my home on this island.” Loretta replied with a gentle smile, flourishing her other hand around to show that they were in a large hut made from local plants and rocks.
“Are there other people on this island?” Tanya asked, feeling more secure now for some reason.

131.content:
Loretta's smile vanished into a depressed frown.

"Sadly no, Tanya... I'm sorry to say this, but you're the first human that I've ever met... Honestly, it does get quite lonely here without any friends to talk to."

Tanya began to feel sorry for this giantess. She had been living all alone on this island for... well, who knows how long!

"That's just terrible,Loretta! Is it okay if I can be your friend?"

Loretta's face brightened up again. She clearly liked this idea.

"Are you sure, Tanya? I mean... Won't you have to go back to the mainland at some point?"

Tanya hadn't thought of that. While she did want to be friends with this giantess who had supposedly saved her life after the storm destroyed her boat, she also wanted to be able to go home.

1311.content:
"Loretta, as much as I would like to go home at some point, I just can't. I'm going to stay here with you. After all, you saved my life... This is the least I can do for you!"

Loretta started crying with joy. Tanya had to move around in Loretta's hand to avoid the boulder sized tears.

"Oh Tanya, you don't know how much this means to me! I've always wanted to have a friend to talk to... How can I ever thank you?"

"Stop trying to drown me!"

Loretta was confused, but she then opened her eyes to notice Tanya evading her massive tears. She quickly wiped her eyes dry and apologized.

"Oh jeez Tanya, I'm so sorry! I didn't mean to..."

"Yeah, I know Loretta... I know... But you need to be a bit more cautious of your size..."

"Okay then... Thanks Tanya"

"Any time, friend! So, how about we sit down and get to know each other better?"

"Okay!"

Loretta then sat down on her bed and positioned Tanya right next to her. They then started talking about their lives.

"So Loretta, how did you get so big? Are you the last member of some long lost clan of giants, or the result of some government experiment, or what?"

"To be completely honest, Tanya, I really don't know... One day I just woke up here on this island, and I was giant sized. I don't have any memories about what my life was like before that, and I can't even remember who my parents were or anything... Your honestly the very first human I've ever met... Or at least as far back as I can remember..."

"Wow... that must have been difficult for you..."

"Yeah, it was at first... But I think that things have gotten better over the years..."

"Well that's good... If you don't mind me asking, why did you save me in the first place?"

"I'm sorry... My reasons were kind of selfish..."

"What do you mean? How could going out of your way to save someone else's life possibly be selfish?"

"Because the only thing I was thinking at the time was 'If I save her, maybe she'll agree to stay here and be my friend...'!"

"Oh come on... That's not selfish! You've been alone on this island for who knows how long! You have every right to want to make at least one friend! I can't begin to say how grateful I am... If it wasn't for you, I'd be at the bottom of the sea with my boat right now!"

"Well... Actually, your boat is right here as well..."

Loretta then pointed to a broken ship on one of her shelves.

"You saved my boat too?!"

"Not really... It was damaged beyond repair by the time I found you... I highly doubt that it will ever function again..."

"Ugh... Well, I figured as much..."

The two then started laughing together.

"So Tanya, what do you want to do now?"


How will Tanya respond?

“As a matter of fact there are others people on this island, people your size I might add.” Loretta said.
“They’re not cannibals or headhunters, are they?” Tanya asked nervously.
“Nah, not enough outsiders come here, which makes those lifestyles useless. The only thing you might have to worry about is that they’re, as one might say, pagan.” Loretta said shaking her head.
“Really? Who do they worship?” Tanya asked, she suspected that the natives probably worshiped several gods like most other pre-Christianity faiths, but she was curious as to which god or gods.
“Me” Loretta replied proudly.
“I beg your pardon?” Tanya asked, not sure that she heard Loretta correctly.
“They worship me, silly.” Loretta said with a giggle.
“You’re not going to make me worship you too are you?” Tanya asked, her nervousness returning again.
“Not unless you want to.” Loretta replied.

Weeks went by as Loretta took care of Tanya. Loretta confirmed Tanya’s fear that rescue was nigh impossible; ocean currents and jagged rock formations that surrounded the island, except for a corridor that lead to other similar islands, effectively isolated the island from the rest of the world.
